definition: to sleep outdoors/to spend the night in the open
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: Miss Jin and I returned to our bedroom to take some sleeping necessities.
sentences.chinese: 於是我和靳兄一起回寢室拿一些露宿必需品。

sentences.english: I stayed at a hotel one night, and camped another two.
sentences.chinese: 我在旅館住了一晚，另外兩晚露宿。

sentences.english: Soldiers are now sleeping rough in dense jungle.
sentences.chinese: 這個旅的士兵現在密林中露宿。

sentences.english: There are lots of bag ladies at Central Park.
sentences.chinese: 紐約中央公園裏有許多露宿街頭，撿破爛的“女人”。

sentences.english: He neglected his schooling and lived on the streets.
Family men still live under the stars, staying close to their animals.
sentences.chinese: 她的族人仍然與牲畜一起露宿在星空下。

sentences.english: They camped in the open and lived on wild plants .
sentences.chinese: 他們在野地露宿，靠喫野萊生活。

sentences.english: "In the open air?" Asked the yogi.
The geological prospectors bedded down for the night under the shelter of leafy trees.
sentences.chinese: 地質勘探隊員們在枝葉茂密的樹下露宿。

sentences.english: The less fortunate might sleep in their cars or a vacant storage unit.
sentences.chinese: 更不幸者只能在車中露宿，或在空倉庫中過夜。

sentences.english: In those days, there were more than 70 people sleeping in the area on a typical night.
sentences.chinese: 在那個時候的夜晚一般會有70多人露宿街頭。

sentences.english: The travellers camped under the shade of trees.
sentences.chinese: 這些旅行者在樹陰下露宿。

sentences.english: Aftershocks follow-up even more frightened residents, but also dare to sleep night falls outside.
sentences.chinese: 後續餘震更令居民驚恐，夜幕低垂也只敢露宿戶外。

sentences.english: The guerrillas camped in the open and lived on wild plants.
sentences.chinese: 游擊隊員在野地露宿，靠喫野菜生活。

sentences.english: A rundown section of a city characterized by drunkards living on the street.
sentences.chinese: 城市的破舊區域，常見到許多酒鬼露宿街頭。

sentences.english: Area residents are taking shelter outdoors as aftershocks continue to rock the region.
sentences.chinese: 目前，餘震不斷，災區居民只能露宿戶外。

definition: to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to make one's bed on the floor
to put up a guest/to stay overnight
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to stop on the way for a rest
dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
